Class Task5

extends java.lang.Object
Task 5 - An Online service using empirical data to help make informed decisions on predicting names for compatible pairs.

    Task 5 - Compute the result of the recommended name which is equal to most popular name in the user's preferred gender with his preferred initial (or the same initial as his initial if it is empty) from 1880 to his year of birth or from his year of birth to 2019 (determined by his preferred age).

    • doFindT5X2

      public static java.lang.String doFindT5X2​(java.lang.String namestring, java.lang.String yearstring, java.lang.String gender, java.lang.String preferredInital, java.lang.String preferredGender, java.lang.String preferredAge)
      Task 5 - Compute the result of the recommended name which is equal to most popular name in the user's preferred gender with his preferred initial (or the same initial as his initial if it is empty) from 1880 to his year of birth or from his year of birth to 2019 (determined by his preferred age).
      Parameters:
      namestring - String inputted for name
      yearstring - String inputted for Year of Birth
      preferredInital - String inputted for Preferred Initial
      gender - String inputted for the user's gender
      preferredAge - String inputted for Preferred Age
      preferredGender - String inputted for preferred Gender
      Returns:
      Console String, a pie chart and a bar chart

    • getMostPopularPersonByInitial

      Task 5 - Search for the most popular people in the databases base on the year, name initial and gender.
      Parameters:
      year - The year wanted to check
      gender - Gender value
      Initial - Preferred Name Initial value
      Returns:
      The people with the year, preferred initial and gender as requested

    • generateOutput

      public static comp3111.popnames.SortedPeopleList generateOutput​(int yearstart, int yearend, java.lang.String gender, java.lang.String initial)
      Task 5 - Generate the output used for displaying charts and data tables.
      Parameters:
      yearstart - Starting Year
      yearend - Ending Year
      initial - Preferred name initial value
      gender - Gender
      Returns:
      A sorted people list with extra info e.g. total occurrences, number of unique person
